newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.African troops help battle against crime.
newsitem.headline: S.African troops help battle against crime.

text.p: South Africa is deploying some 6,000-7,000 troops a day onto its streets to help fight crime, seen by many as the country's number one problem, the army said on Tuesday.

The South African National Defence Force also said in a statement it had arrested 23,000 illegal immigrants and 1,841 criminals so far this year, and recovered 426 stolen cows, sheep and goats and 195 vehicles.
The country's police service employs some 140,000 people but is struggling to crack down on pervasive violent crime. South Africa has the world's highest rape rate and one of the worst murder rates.
